story.text: (Updates share price) NEW YORK Jan 3 (Reuters) - Shares of natural gas company Spectra Energy Corp. (SE.N) extended its early gains, up more than 4 percent, Wednesday on its first day of trading on the New York Stock Exchange. Spectra's spinoff from Duke Energy Corp. (DUK.N) was completed on Jan. 2. Spectra shares rose $1.20, or 4.3 percent to $28.95, while Duke shares pared back early gains, now up .02 cents, or 0.1 percent, to $19.17.
story.title: update 1 - spectra energy extends gain on first day of trading
